newsitem.title: USA: Mafco sets going private, special payout.
newsitem.headline: Mafco sets going private, special payout.

text.p: Mafco Consolidated Group Inc said directors have approved the purchase of its publicly held shares and a special cash dividend.
Together, the company said, the transactions will result in a payment of $43.50 per share in cash to public holders.

Under a merger agreement approved by Mafco Consolidated directors, the company said, its 85 percent stockholder, Mafco Holdings Inc will acquire all publicly held Mafco Consolidated common shares for $33.50 each.
The special cash dividend of $10 per share is payable March 14 to holders of record March 10, the company said.
It said payment of the dividend is not conditioned on completion of the merger which is expected to close during the second quarter.
The merger price can be adjusted upward if the the average closing price of Consolidated Cigar Holdings Inc for the 10 trading days prior to the Mafco merger exceeds $33.

The merger is not conditioned on Mafco completing its previously announced offering of the 5 million Consolidated Cigar shares it holds, Mafco said. It is subject to approval by Mafco stockholders and review by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
Mafco Holdings has agreed to vote in favor of the merger.
In addition to 80.2 percent of Consolidated Cigar, Mafco Consolidated holds about 36 percent of Power Control Technologies Inc's common.
